intro: Dudleya abramsii, commonly known as Abrams' liveforever, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped, pinkish-white flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, coastal climates. Dudleya abramsii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
